title: Continuity in topological spaces - misc. additions

blocks.name: mndpluscn
blocks.content: A mapping that is both a homeomorphism and a monoid homomorphism preserves the "continuousness" of the operation. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-Mar-2017.)
blocks.origin:

  a1ii(c0 ∈((c1[tX]c1)[Cn]c1), (c4 :(c5 × c5)→ c5))

  mp2b(c0 =(hs0 ∈ c6, hs1 ∈ c6 ↦(hs0[c0]hs1)), (c0 :(c6 × c6)→ c6), c0[Fn](c6 × c6))

  anim12i(hs0 ∈ c6, hs1 ∈ c6, (`' c2 ` hs0)∈ c5, (`' c2 ` hs1)∈ c5)
  mpan(hs0 ∈ c6, (`' c2 ` hs0)∈ c5, (c2 : c5 ↔ c6))
  f1ocnvdm(c2, c5, c6, hs0)
  mpan(hs1 ∈ c6, (`' c2 ` hs1)∈ c5, (c2 : c5 ↔ c6))
  f1ocnvdm(c2, c5, c6, hs1)
  rgen2a(s0, s1, c5, (c2 `(s0[c4]s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c0](c2 ` s1)))
  rspc2va(s0, s1, (`' c2 ` hs0), c5, (`' c2 ` hs1), c5, (c2 `(s0[c4]s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c0](c2 ` s1)), (c2 `((`' c2 ` hs0)[c4](`' c2 ` hs1)))=((c2 `(`' c2 ` hs0))[c0](c2 `(`' c2 ` hs1))), (c2 `((`' c2 ` hs0)[c4]s1))=((c2 `(`' c2 ` hs0))[c0](c2 ` s1)))
  eqeq12d((c2 `(s0[c4]s1)), ((c2 ` s0)[c0](c2 ` s1)), (c2 `((`' c2 ` hs0)[c4]s1)), ((c2 `(`' c2 ` hs0))[c0](c2 ` s1)), s0 =(`' c2 ` hs0))

  cnmpt22f(hs0, hs1, c6, c6, (`' c2 ` hs0), c4, (`' c2 ` hs1), c1, c1, c3, c3, c3, wtru)

blocks.name: mhmhmeotmd
blocks.content: Deduce a Topological Monoid using mapping that is both a homeomorphism and a monoid homomorphism. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm mhmhmeotmd(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wcel(c0, ctmd)
